name: Sarit Hadad
description: '''Sarit Hadad''' ({{langx|he|שרית חדד}}, {{IPA|he|saˈʁit χaˈdad| }}; born '''Sarah Hudadatov''', 20 September 1978) is an Israeli singer. She was named by [[Channel 24 (Israel)|Channel 24]] as the "best female singer of the 2000s" in October 2009. She represented [[Israel]] with the song "[[Nadlik Beyakhad Ner|Light a Candle]]" at the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2002]] in [[Tallinn|Tallinn, Estonia]].
